text: - Are you all kidding me?

- I'm here because of jealousy
and fear and insecurity.
- You don't know how hard this game is
until you're in Alan's castle.
I am a huge fan of “Traitors.”
My highs are everything Alan related.
Seeing Alan Cumming, the icon that he is,
I was like, this is what I signed up for.
The only low would be,

it's a personal low
being a heart attack survivor,

I just couldn't
do the things that I used to do,

and I got very emotional,
and that was very tough for me.
But as we get older, you got to pivot,

I can't be the person that I was
in my 20s, 30s, or 40s, you know.
And I'm good with that.

- I am debatably the greatest player
on “The Traitors” of all time.
Now granted, I did not do very well,
but you all know

that I know that
you know that I know
that I'm the best.
My reputation precedes me.
I am a Traitor at heart,
and that's why I got voted out.
They made the right move

because I was not going
to end that game
with anybody but myself.
- I think that I was such a loyal Faithful,

everyone was looking to me
to kind of calm,

calm the room
and just kind of bring in evidence.
People were thinking,

“Oh, we got to get Bob out of this house
because he is so trusted.”
That's where I messed up.
- I just lost to the Round Table,

but I look back at,
like, that final discussion, and it could,
I could not have done any better.
A few people really surprised me,
the biggest one being Dylan.
Dylan said multiple times
that I'm like his brother,

and obviously, like,
if you know anything about him,

you know that I would be
his best-looking brother.

And so when he voted
that I was a Traitor,
it's kind of like, that hurts.

I'm here because of jealousy
and fear and insecurity.

I mean, I think that I look the part,
I sound the part.

I mean, I'm a cocky douchebag
with a glorious red ginger beard.
- I have learned from hindsight
that you need to speak your mind.
If you are feeling something,

you've got to be 
confident enough to be unpopular.

If I had to do differently
at the Round Table,
I absolutely would not have voted Nikki,
I would have voted Rob.

Rob came across so confident
about Bob the Drag Queen.

I was thinking, “Oh, my God, he knows that
Bob is a Traitor because he's a Traitor.”
And he turned on another Traitor.
- I just think that Rob is a Traitor,

I think that he got caught
outing a Traitor.

At the end of the day, like, Rob is good, 
I'm better.

- When are you going to start
giving me some information?
Wait, hold on, fast forward, zzz,
and the Traitors are,
your turn.
Oh, my God, I'm so nervous.

Yes, I do want to know,
but I don't want to know,
I do, I don't, I do, I don't.
Oh, my God, this is so exciting.
- This is real?
You're not fucking with me,
you're not going to say like...
Is this real?
- I don't even want to open it,
I don't even think my heart can take this.
- Danielle.
- You are
kidding me.
- Very impressive woman.

She's playing really, really good,
so good.
- Oh, my God, I'm such an idiot,
I defended Danielle

at Round Table going,
“I trust her.”
That bitch.
I mean, she got me.
- She voted for me at the end to stay
and for Rob to go.
Oh, this is mind boggling right now.
- Carolyn, fucking Carolyn.
Are you all kidding me?
Carolyn's like an evil genius.
I mean, I wrote her off.
I am the worst player.
- Carolyn just went at Danielle hard.

The question is, “Were they going at it,
or was that controlled chaos?”

Like, was Carolyn going at Danielle
to throw them off each scents?
I can see her in that turret,
you know, making all of her faces.
Okay, so back up,

when I was with Danielle
a couple days ago,

she was like, “Don't tell anybody this,
but I think Carolyn...”
That's, this is real beef.
There's real Traitor beef.
They are going to fight

in the turret about all the things
that happened at the Round Table.
- Rob, I knew it.

- Rob, I've been vindicated
at least a little bit.
- Wow, my brain is just like,
“Do you see smoke coming out of my ears?”

- That means I was this close
to getting a lot of traction in that game.

If Dylan had voted for me to stay
instead of go,
Rob would have stood on that circle,

I would have looked like
the most Faithful guy in the entire game,

I would have been
the one to have taken him down,

and the theory of one of the three
Cage Boys would have been gone forever.

- I mean,
I thought that Carolyn and Danielle,

you know, were, well I mean,
I thought they were on my side,
so I would immediately think

that Rob was the one that said,
“I've got to get out.”

You don't know how hard this game is
until you are in Alan's castle.
- Dang, that is cool, that was exciting.
I didn't see that coming,

I really did think
I was gonna have to wait,

because I'm back in fan mode now,
and I'm a huge fan of this game.

- Please tell me you're going to tell me
who got banished last night.
I need to know.
- The banished person is coming
to see you.
- Oh, my God,

I'm getting, y'all going to give me, like,
another heart attack.

There's something,
now I'm just, like, scared.
Like, who's behind me?
I don't trust anybody.
What?
- Hey buddy.
- How did that happen?
- I guess we have a lot to talk about.

- I really wanted it to be Rob
walking in here.

- I called out Rob, and I got into
a big thing with him at the Round Table.
I was this close to having,

having the game by my,
by the fucking balls.
- Right, you're super competitive.
- Incredibly.

- Did the other Traitors vote?
- So...

- Rob?
- Danielle voted Rob,
Carolyn voted Danielle.
- Interesting.

- And Danielle has been for days
saying Carolyn,
so it's like, there is a lot of infighting.

- But do you believe
that Rob will be sitting here next?
- Yeah.

- Unless Rob is an absolute genius
to turn that around.
- Yeah.
- Why do you think they murdered me?

- Because you were the
devil's advocate against Rob.

- Yep.
- We all praised him.

- Yep.
- We all got down on our knees.

- Yeah.
- Because I was afraid of getting murdered.

- Yeah.
- And you didn't get down on your knees.

- No, I ain't getting down on my knees
for no Rob.
- [laughs]

- Do you want to know
what I've been kicking myself over?
I trusted Danielle.
- Okay, here's, that's my question for you.

Is she that good of an actress,
or is she trembling out of fear
of that's just how hard the job is?

- No, I think that she knows
exactly what she's doing.

- Yeah.
- Like, she fooled me.

- Yep.
- And that pissed me off.

When I found out
that Carolyn was a Traitor,
I was in shock.

I was like, I was like,
this woman is a bag of nuts,
there's no way.

- Yeah.
- There's no way she's a Traitor.
- Yeah, she's the perfect one though.

- She's the perfect one.
- Yeah.
I think that Carolyn has no sway,
no pull, can't defend herself,

and I think that Danielle is watching Rob
shoot himself in the foot.

- Yeah.
- Why does Danielle care?
There were some things that we got wrong,

but you being the devil's advocate
and then getting murdered,
and me going so hard,

we're going to end this
as insightful dead people,
dead and banished.

- I'm so bummed because I feel like, 
the Faithfuls lost two really good people.

- Yeah, yeah.
- They really did, and the Traitors love it.
- Like, I at least got to confront my adversary.

- Yes, yes.
- Yes.

Your grieving process
is going to be a little different.

- Yeah.
- And disjointed, mine started.

- One thing that I found out about myself is,
you know, I'm not a liar,

I'm not a good,
I'm not a good liar if I have to.
- You would have, and you could have,
and you know it.

You could have done it,
and you would have been good.

- Well, coming from you,
because I think,

I think you are
one of the better game players,

and that's why
you're probably sitting here right now.
- Yeah, I know that is,

but yeah,
that is a compliment on my behalf.

Like, if I would have died to
be in that turret with you,
we wouldn't have needed any help.
- That's right.

- It's not too late,
we're still in Scotland.
If anyone wants to do...

- No, I am going home.
- [laughs]
- I, you know what, end scene.
[laughs]
